alert.note: Alert for Northern Outer Banks (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued April 29 at 4:03PM EDT until April 29 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM SUNDAY TO 2 AM EDT MONDAY... * WHAT...For the Beach Hazards Statement, dangerous rip currents. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, 1 to 2 feet of inundation above ground level expected in soundside low-lying areas. * WHERE...Northern Outer Banks beaches and areas adjacent to the Albemarle, Croatan and Roanoke Sounds. * WHEN...For the Beach Hazards Statement, until 8 PM EDT this evening. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, from 11 AM Sunday to 2 AM EDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of lots, parks, and roads with only isolated road closures expected. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Oregon Inlet NC MLLW Categories - Minor 3.0 ft, Moderate 4.5 ft, Major 5.5 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 2.4 ft, Moderate 3.9 ft, Major 4.9 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 29/04 PM 1.9 1.3 1.5 1 None 30/04 AM 2.2 1.6 1.7 1-2 None 30/06 PM 3.2 2.6 2.7 2-3 Minor 01/05 PM 2.4 1.8 1.9 1 None 02/06 AM 2.4 1.8 1.9 1-2 None &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Life-threatening rip currents. If caught in a rip current, remain calm. Swim in a direction following the shoreline. If tired, float or tread water until out of the rip current. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
